title: Were the counts and lesser nobility in the Middle Ages owners of their land, or was that land owned by the king? Could they sell their land and do what they want with it? - Quora
tags: King's Landing (A Song of Ice and Fire location)

response.answer_text: In the middle ages, all property was owned by the crown, and held in trust by the nobility. The peasants paid a tax to their lord, who paid a tax to his baron, who paid a tax to his count, who paid a tax to his Duke, who paid a tax to his king. Any change of hands with regards to land would have had to be approved by the crown, generally done via the chancellor of the exchequer.
